remarks: The function ` F ` , the divisor sum of a Dirichlet character, is a multiplicative function (but not completely multiplicative). Equation 9.4.27 of [Shapiro], p. 382.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 5-May-2016.)
statement:
rpvmasum.z $e |- Z = ( Z/nZ ` N ) $.
rpvmasum.l $e |- L = ( ZRHom ` Z ) $.
rpvmasum.a $e |- ( ph -> N e. NN ) $.
rpvmasum2.g $e |- G = ( DChr ` N ) $.
rpvmasum2.d $e |- D = ( Base ` G ) $.
rpvmasum2.1 $e |- .1. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
dchrisum0f.f $e |- F = ( b e. NN |-> sum_ v e. { q e. NN | q || b } ( X ` ( L ` v ) ) ) $.
dchrisum0f.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. D ) $.
dchrisum0fmul.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. NN ) $.
dchrisum0fmul.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. NN ) $.
dchrisum0fmul.m $e |- ( ph -> ( A gcd B ) = 1 ) $.
dchrisum0fmul $p |- ( ph -> ( F ` ( A x. B ) ) = ( ( F ` A ) x. ( F ` B ) ) ) $.
$d A b q v $.
$d B b q v $.
$d L b v $.
$d N q $.
$d X b v $.
